intro: Geostachys secunda, commonly known as the mountain thyme or red thyme, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Geostachys secunda thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in alpine or subalpine environments.
